conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the magnetic induction B such that the particle just leaves the magnetic field region on the left side of M for the first time from point f.
The radius R of the particle's circular path can be found using the relationship R = mv_0 / qB.
The particle is injected at an angle of 45 degrees to MN.
The vertical and horizontal components of the velocity are v_0x = v_0y = v_0 / sqrt(2).
The particle travels in a circular path and collides with the insulating plate ab.
The vertical component of the velocity remains unchanged, and the horizontal component reverses direction.
The particle exits from point f, which is 2d horizontally from c.
The total horizontal distance covered by the particle in the circular path is 2d, so the path is a semicircle with diameter 2d.
The radius R of the semicircle is d.
Using the radius R = d in the equation for the radius of the circular path, d = mv_0 / qB.
Rearrange the equation to solve for B: B = mv_0 / qd.
The magnitude of the magnetic induction B is mv_0 / qd.
